Description: ALFWorld contains interactive TextWorld environments that parallel embodied worlds in the ALFRED dataset, divided into six categories of sub-tasks, encompassing a total of 134 environments.

Example.Intent:
heat some apple and put it in fridge.

Description: ScienceWorld is a complex interactive text environment designed specifically to assess a model’s inference and commonsense capabilities. The environment consists of 8 distinct functional rooms (e.g., workshop, kitchen), an outside place, and a hallway. The agent is required to navigate to the appropriate room based on given tasks, such as ”measure the melting point of the orange juice”, and utilize the tools within that room to complete the task

Example.Intent:
Your task is to find the animal with the longest life span, then the shortest life span. Focus on the animal with the longest life span. You also need to focus on the animal with the shortest life span. The animals are in the 'outside' location.
   Init observation: This room is called the art studio. In it, you see: the agent a substance called air a large cupboard. The large cupboard door is closed. a table. On the table is: a bowl (containing nothing). ...

No known action matches that input.

> focus on baby dragonfly

Description: BabyAI is a platform to study language learning with a human in the loop. The platform includes 19 levels of increasing difficulty, based on a decomposition of tasks into a set of basic competencies. The language is minimalistic and the levels seem simple, but empirically them are quite challenging to solve. The platform is open source and extensible, meaning new levels and language concepts can be integrated easily.

Example.Intent:
open the red door, and open the blue door

Description: Jericho contains 20 environments for interactive text-based games. The games feature fictional scenarios and require players to solve complex puzzles while keeping themselves alive. This task is especially challenging for models as the agent needs to explore and learn the rules of the fictional world without prior knowledge.

Example.Intent:
You need to find your way into a secret passage where the entrance is in the living room of the house.
   Init observation: You are standing in an open field west of a white house, with a boarded front door. There is a small mailbox here.
Example.Trajectory:
> look
West of House You are standing in an open field west of a white house, with a boarded front door. There is a small mailbox here.

> check valid actions
You can take the following actions: open mailbox, north, south, west, check valid actions

> open mailbox
Opening the small mailbox reveals a leaflet.

> take leaflet
Taken.

> read leaflet
"WELCOME TO ZORK! ZORK is a game of adventure, danger, and low cunning. In it you will explore some of the most amazing territory ever seen by mortals. No computer should be without one!"

> check valid actions
You can take the following actions: close mailbox, put down leaflet, north, put leaflet in mailbox, south, west, check valid actions

> north
North of House You are facing the north side of a white house. There is no door here, and all the windows are boarded up. To the north a narrow path winds through the trees.

> check valid actions
You can take the following actions: put down leaflet, east, north, west, check valid actions

> east
Behind House You are behind the white house. A path leads into the forest to the east. In one corner of the house there is a small window which is slightly ajar. (reward: 0.16666666666666666)

> check valid actions
You can take the following actions: open window, put down leaflet, south, north, east, check valid actions

> open window
With great effort, you open the window far enough to allow entry. (reward: 0.3333333333333333)

> climb through window
Kitchen You are in the kitchen of the white house. A table seems to have been used recently for the preparation of food. A passage leads to the west and a dark staircase can be seen leading upward. A dark chimney leads down and to the east is a small window which is open. On the table is an elongated brown sack, smelling of hot peppers. A bottle is sitting on the table. The glass bottle contains: A quantity of water (reward: 0.5)

> examine table
On the table is an elongated brown sack, smelling of hot peppers. A bottle is sitting on the table. The glass bottle contains: A quantity of water

> take brown sack
Taken.

> examine brown sack
The brown sack is closed.

> open brown sack
Opening the brown sack reveals a lunch, and a clove of garlic.

> take garlic
Taken.

> take bottle
Taken.

> check valid actions
You can take the following actions: jump, east, open bottle, take food, up, close sack, close window, put down leaflet, put down sack, put down garlic, put down food, put down bottle, put down all, shake sack, put leaflet in sack, put leaflet on table, put sack on table, put garlic in sack, put garlic on table, put food on table, put bottle in sack, put bottle on table, put water on table, put all on table, west, check valid actions

> go west
Living Room You are in the living room. There is a doorway to the east, a wooden door with strange gothic lettering to the west, which appears to be nailed shut, a trophy case, and a large oriental rug in the center of the room. Above the trophy case hangs an elvish sword of great antiquity. A battery-powered brass lantern is on the trophy case. (reward: 0.6666666666666666)

> examine trophy case
The trophy case is empty.

> examine elvish sword
There's nothing special about the sword.

> take lantern
Taken.

> examine gothic lettering
The engravings translate to "This space intentionally left blank."

> check valid actions
You can take the following actions: turn on lantern, open case, open bottle, take lunch, take sword, close sack, put down sack, put down garlic, put down lantern, put down lunch, put down bottle, put down leaflet, put down all, push rug, shake sack, put garlic in sack, put bottle in sack, put leaflet in sack, throw sack at lantern, east, check valid actions

> push rug
With a great effort, the rug is moved to one side of the room, revealing the dusty cover of a closed trap door. (reward: 0.8333333333333334)

> open trap door
The door reluctantly opens to reveal a rickety staircase descending into darkness. (reward: 1.0)

Description: PDDL envioronments are based on four tasks defined in planning domain definition language. There are altogether 60 envioronments in PDDL task and require agents to perform planning and solve puzzles. This task calls for strong planning ability.

Description: WebShop is a simulated e-commerce website environment with 1.18 million real-world products and we random choose 251 crowd-sourced text instructions. In this environment, an agent needs to navigate multiple types of webpages and issue diverse actions to find, customize, and purchase a product given an instruction. This task calls for strategic exploration ability.

Example.Intent:
i'm looking for a queen size bedspread set in the color redwood, and price lower than 70.00 dollars
   Init observation: WEB PAGE: {Let us begin shopping [Search]}

Description: Webarena is a comprehensive network environment containing four major domains: e-commerce, social forums, collaborative software development, and content management. Furthermore, it integrates various utility tools, such as maps and wikis. We selected and adapted 245 test instances from the existing dataset. This task calls for exhibit intricate long-term planning and robust reasoning capabilities.

Description: The academia environment equips agents to query information related to computer science research, including academic papers and author information. In its development, we harness data from the Citation Network Dataset, craft the relevant functions, and subsequently introduce the academia tool.

Example.Intent:
Is the article 'Road Traffic Forecast Based on Meteorological Information through Deep Learning Methods' from the same publication venue as 'Dynamic Selection Techniques for Detecting GPS Spoofing Attacks on UAVs'? Please answer 'Yes' or 'No'.
   Init observation: Once you have finished the goal, please remember to take 'finish' action to end this goal.
Example.Trajectory:
> loadPaperNet with Action Input: {}
PaperNet is loaded. (reward: 0.25)

> paperNodeCheck with Action Input: {"node": "Road Traffic Forecast Based on Meteorological Information through Deep Learning Methods"}
{'authors': ['João Ferreira', 'João Almeida', 'Pedro F. C. Goncalves'], 'year': 2022, 'venue': 'SENSORS', 'n_citation': 0, 'keywords': ['weather-based traffic prediction', 'highway traffic', 'deep learning', 'method comparison'], 'doc_type': 'Journal'} (reward: 0.5)

> paperNodeCheck with Action Input: {"node": "Dynamic Selection Techniques for Detecting GPS Spoofing Attacks on UAVs"}
{'authors': [], 'year': 2022, 'venue': 'SENSORS', 'n_citation': 0, 'keywords': ['unmanned aerial vehicles', 'global positioning system', 'GPS spoofing attacks', 'detection techniques', 'machine learning', 'dynamic selection', 'hyperparameter tuning'], 'doc_type': 'Journal'} (reward: 0.75)

> paperNodeCheck with Action Input: {"node": "Dynamic Selection Techniques for Detecting GPS Spoofing Attacks on UAVs"}
{'authors': [], 'year': 2022, 'venue': 'SENSORS', 'n_citation': 0, 'keywords': ['unmanned aerial vehicles', 'global positioning system', 'GPS spoofing attacks', 'detection techniques', 'machine learning', 'dynamic selection', 'hyperparameter tuning'], 'doc_type': 'Journal'}

> authorNodeCheck with Action Input: {"node": "João Ferreira"}
Please load the AuthorNet first.

> loadAuthorNet with Action Input: {}
AuthorNet is loaded.

> authorNodeCheck with Action Input: {"node": "João Ferreira"}
{'name': 'João Ferreira', 'org': 'Univ Aveiro, Dept Elect Telecomunicacoes & Informat, P-3810193 Aveiro, Portugal'}

> authorNodeCheck with Action Input: {"node": "João Almeida"}
{'name': 'João Almeida', 'org': 'Univ Aveiro, Inst Telecomunicacoes, P-3810193 Aveiro, Portugal'}

> authorEdgeCheck with Action Input: {"node1": "João Ferreira", "node2": "João Almeida"}
{'collaborative_papers': ['Road Traffic Forecast Based on Meteorological Information through Deep Learning Methods']}

> paperNodeCheck with Action Input: {"node": "Road Traffic Forecast Based on Meteorological Information through Deep Learning Methods"}
{'authors': ['João Ferreira', 'João Almeida', 'Pedro F. C. Goncalves'], 'year': 2022, 'venue': 'SENSORS', 'n_citation': 0, 'keywords': ['weather-based traffic prediction', 'highway traffic', 'deep learning', 'method comparison'], 'doc_type': 'Journal'}

> finish with Action Input: {"answer": "Yes"}
Yes (reward: 1.0)

Description: The movie environment grants agents access to cinematic data, encompassing film details, personnel and production companies. We incorporate the API and data from The Movie Database, implement the necessary functions, and thus establish the movie tool.

Example.Intent:
Is Black Panther: Wakanda Forever a movie produced by Marvel Studios? Answer Yes or No.
   Init observation: Once you have finished the goal, please remember to take 'finish' action to end this goal.
Example.Trajectory:
> get_search_movie with Action Input: {"movie_name": "Black Panther: Wakanda Forever"}
[{'id': 505642, 'overview': 'Queen Ramonda, Shuri, M’Baku, Okoye and the Dora Milaje fight to protect their nation from intervening world powers in the wake of King T’Challa’s death. As the Wakandans strive to embrace their next chapter, the heroes must band together with the help of War Dog Nakia and Everett Ross and forge a new path for the kingdom of Wakanda.', 'title': 'Black Panther: Wakanda Forever'}] (reward: 0.3333333333333333)

> get_movie_production_companies with Action Input: {"movie_id": "505642"}
{'production_companies': [{'id': 420, 'logo_path': '/hUzeosd33nzE5MCNsZxCGEKTXaQ.png', 'name': 'Marvel Studios', 'origin_country': 'US'}]} (reward: 0.6666666666666666)

> finish with Action Input: {"answer": "Yes"}
Yes (reward: 1.0)

Description: The weather environment enables agents to retrieve past, present and future weather data, encompassing temperature, precipitation and air quality across various locales. We use Python to integrate Open-Meteo API, implement the requisite functions and subsequently develop a weather tool.

Example.Intent:
The recent rainfall has been quite substantial. It feels like there wasn't much rain last year. Is today's rainfall higher than last year's on the same day? Answer Yes or No.
   Init observation: If you want to get the latitude and longitude information of a city, you must call "get_latitude_longitude", do not generate it by yourself which maybe wrong. Once you have finished the goal, please remember to take 'finish' action to end this goal.
Example.Trajectory:
> get_user_current_location with Action Input: {}
Pittsburgh (reward: 0.16666666666666666)

> get_latitude_longitude with Action Input: {"name": "Pittsburgh"}
{'results': [{'name': 'Pittsburgh', 'latitude': 40.44062, 'longitude': -79.99589, 'country_code': 'US'}, {'name': 'Hymera', 'latitude': 39.18643, 'longitude': -87.30168, 'country_code': 'US'}, {'name': 'Tipton', 'latitude': 39.34307, 'longitude': -98.4709, 'country_code': 'US'}]} (reward: 0.3333333333333333)

> get_user_current_date with Action Input: {}
2013-08-19 (reward: 0.5)

> get_historical_rain with Action Input: {"latitude": 40.44062, "longitude": -79.99589, "start_date": "2012-08-19", "end_date": "2012-08-19"}
{'latitude': 40.45694, 'longitude': -79.97177, 'daily_units': {'time': 'iso8601', 'rain_sum': 'mm'}, 'daily': {'time': ['2012-08-19'], 'rain_sum': [0.4]}} (reward: 0.6666666666666666)

> get_historical_rain with Action Input: {"latitude": 40.44062, "longitude": -79.99589, "start_date": "2013-08-19", "end_date": "2013-08-19"}
Error: start_date should be earlier than current_date

> get_historical_rain with Action Input: {"latitude": 40.44062, "longitude": -79.99589, "start_date": "2013-08-18", "end_date": "2013-08-18"}
{'latitude': 40.45694, 'longitude': -79.97177, 'daily_units': {'time': 'iso8601', 'rain_sum': 'mm'}, 'daily': {'time': ['2013-08-18'], 'rain_sum': [1.8]}}

> get_current_rain with Action Input: {"latitude": 40.44062, "longitude": -79.99589, "current_date": "2013-08-19"}
{'latitude': 40.45694, 'longitude': -79.97177, 'daily_units': {'time': 'iso8601', 'rain_sum': 'mm'}, 'daily': {'time': ['2013-08-19'], 'rain_sum': [4.6]}} (reward: 0.8333333333333334)

> get_current_rain with Action Input: {"latitude": 40.44062, "longitude": -79.99589, "current_date": "2013-08-19"}
{'latitude': 40.45694, 'longitude': -79.97177, 'daily_units': {'time': 'iso8601', 'rain_sum': 'mm'}, 'daily': {'time': ['2013-08-19'], 'rain_sum': [4.6]}}

Description: The todo environment facilitates agents in querying and amending personal task list data, encapsulated using the Todoist API

Example.Intent:
When is the due date of Solve algebra equations in Homework and Assignments? Please provide the answer in the YYYY-MM-DD format.
   Init observation: Once you have finished the goal, please remember to take 'finish' action to end this goal.

Description: The sheet environment allows agents to access and modify spreadsheet data, built upon the Google Sheet API

Example.Intent:
In "Sheet14", complete the table with the missing elements based on the information provided : [['Maintenance', 'Marketing', 'Finance'], ['Jane Smith', 'James Wilson', 'Linda Jackson']]. Then, sort the table in descending order by "Time required".
